attributes.action: Acknowledge that illegal behaviour by Leave might have changed the 2016 result
attributes.additional_details: The Electoral Commission’s ruled that it broke the law by channelling hundreds of thousands of pounds of donations to an ostensibly independent campaign group, BeLeave.
attributes.background: Government to acknowledge that the judgment by the Electoral Commision that the Vote Leave Campaign undertook illegal activity, might mean that the 2016 referendum result might well not have been the will of the people.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the UK Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.

There are already lots of petitions calling for a second referendum, or public inquiries into Brexit and the EU referendum campaign, for example:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/241848

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/245297

You might like to sign one of these petitions. You are more likely to get action on an issue if you sign and share a single petition.
